desc1.pins1: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.
desc1.pins3: dW - debugWIRE On-chip debug system uses a One-wire, bi-directional interface to control the program flow, execute AVR instructions in the CPU and to program the different non-volatile memories.

desc2.pins2: RXD - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up.

desc3.pins2: TXD - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output.

desc4.pins1: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

desc5.pins1: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)

desc6.pins2: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc7.pins2: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc8.pins2: T0 - Timer/Counter0 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc9.pins2: T1 - Timer/Counter1 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.
desc9.pins3: OC0B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc11.pins2: ICP1 - Timer/Counter1 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter1 description for further details.

desc12.pins2: AIN0 - AIN0, Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc13.pins2: AIN1 - AIN1, Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc14.pins2: OC0A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc15.pins2: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc16.pins2: OC1B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc17.pins2: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.
desc17.pins3: SDA - 2-wire Serial Bus Data: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Data I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal, and the pin is driven by an open collector driver with slew rate limitation.
desc17.pins5: DI - Data Input - Universal serial interface

desc18.pins2: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.
desc18.pins4: DO - Data Output - Universal serial interface

desc19.pins2: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.
desc19.pins3: USCK - 3-wire mode Universal serial interface clock
